subject: Steroids
Doping (Sports)
Attorneys General
lead_paragraph: Saying the federal government does little to regulate the multibillion-dollar supplement industry, some of which is tainted by steroids, the leader of the United States Anti-Doping Agency urged attorneys general to take action on the state level. Travis Tygart, Usada’s chief executive, spoke at a conference of attorneys general, urging them to use state consumer protection laws to help prevent tainted and steroid-related supplements from reaching the market.
snippet: Saying the federal government does little to regulate the multibillion-dollar supplement industry, some of which is tainted by steroids, the leader of the United States Anti-Doping Agency urged attorneys general to take action on the state level....
